data.name: DuplicateMigrationName
data.value: The name '{migrationName}' is used by an existing migration.

data.name: MultipleContexts
data.value: More than one DbContext was found. Specify which one to use. Use the '-Context' parameter for PowerShell commands and the '--context' parameter for dotnet commands.

data.name: MultipleContextsWithName
data.value: More than one DbContext named '{name}' was found. Specify which one to use by providing its fully qualified name.

data.name: MultipleContextsWithQualifiedName
data.value: More than one DbContext named '{name}' was found. Specify which one to use by providing its fully qualified name using its exact case.

data.name: NoContext
data.value: No DbContext was found in assembly '{assembly}'. Ensure that you're using the correct assembly and that the type is neither abstract nor generic.

data.name: NoContextWithName
data.value: No DbContext named '{name}' was found.

data.name: LogUseContext
data.value: Using context '{name}'.

data.name: LogDroppingDatabase
data.value: Dropping database '{name}'.

data.name: LogDatabaseDropped
data.value: Successfully dropped database '{name}'.

data.name: Cancelled
data.value: Cancelled.

data.name: ManuallyDeleted
data.value: A manual migration deletion was detected.

data.name: NoMigrationFile
data.value: No file named '{file}' was found. You must manually remove the migration class '{migrationClass}'.

data.name: NoMigrationMetadataFile
data.value: No file named '{file}' was found.

data.name: NoSnapshot
data.value: No ModelSnapshot was found.

data.name: NoSnapshotFile
data.value: No file named '{file}' was found. You must manually remove the model snapshot class '{snapshotClass}'.

data.name: RemovingMigration
data.value: Removing migration '{name}'.

data.name: RemovingSnapshot
data.value: Removing model snapshot.

data.name: RevertingSnapshot
data.value: Reverting model snapshot.

data.name: UnapplyMigration
data.value: The migration '{name}' has already been applied to the database. Unapply it and try again. If the migration has been applied to other databases, consider reverting its changes using a new migration.

data.name: UnknownOperation
data.value: The current CSharpMigrationOperationGenerator cannot scaffold operations of type '{operationType}'. Configure your services to use one that can.

data.name: UnknownLiteral
data.value: The current CSharpHelper cannot scaffold literals of type '{literalType}'. Configure your services to use one that can.

data.name: CannotFindRuntimeProviderAssembly
data.value: Unable to find provider assembly with name {assemblyName}. Ensure the specified name is correct and is referenced by the project.

data.name: DestructiveOperation
data.value: An operation was scaffolded that may result in the loss of data. Please review the migration for accuracy.

data.name: ReusingDirectory
data.value: Reusing directory of file '{file}'.

data.name: WritingMigration
data.value: Writing migration to '{file}'.

data.name: WritingSnapshot
data.value: Writing model snapshot to '{file}'.

data.name: Done
data.value: Done.

data.name: ReusingNamespace
data.value: Reusing namespace of type '{type}'.

data.name: ReusingSnapshotName
data.value: Reusing model snapshot name '{name}'.

data.name: CannotFindDesignTimeProviderAssembly
data.value: Unable to find design-time provider assembly. Please install the {designTimeProviderAssemblyName} NuGet package and ensure that the package is referenced by the project.

data.name: CannotFindDesignTimeProviderAssemblyAttribute
data.value: Unable to find expected assembly attribute named {attributeName} in provider assembly {runtimeProviderAssemblyName}. This attribute is required to identify the class which acts as the design-time service provider factory.

data.name: NonRelationalProvider
data.value: {provider} is not a Relational provider and therefore cannot be use with Migrations.

data.name: UnreferencedAssembly
data.value: Could not load assembly '{assembly}'. Ensure it is referenced by the startup project '{startupProject}'.

data.name: LogFindingContexts
data.value: Finding DbContext classes...

data.name: ForeignMigrations
data.value: The namespace '{migrationsNamespace}' contains migrations for a different DbContext. This can result in conflicting migration names. It's recommend to put migrations for different DbContext classes into different namespaces.

data.name: ConnectionStringRequired
data.value: ConnectionString is required to generate code.

data.name: ContextClassNotValidCSharpIdentifier
data.value: The context class name passed in, {contextClassName}, is not a valid C# identifier.

data.name: ProjectPathRequired
data.value: ProjectPath is required to generate code.

data.name: RootNamespaceRequired
data.value: Root namespace of the project is required to generate code.

data.name: MigrationsAssemblyMismatch
data.value: Your target project '{assembly}' doesn't match your migrations assembly '{migrationsAssembly}'. Either change your target project or change your migrations assembly. Change your migrations assembly by using DbContextOptionsBuilder. E.g. options.UseSqlServer(connection, b => b.MigrationsAssembly("{assembly}")). By default, the migrations assembly is the assembly containing the DbContext. Change your target project to the migrations project by using the Package Manager Console's Default project drop-down list, or by executing "dotnet ef" from the directory containing the migrations project.

data.name: SensitiveInformationWarning
data.value: To protect potentially sensitive information in your connection string, you should move it out of source code. See http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=723263 for guidance on storing connection strings.
data.comment: Localize the URL if we have localized docs.

data.name: ForceRemoveMigration
data.value: Removing migration '{name}' without checking the database. If this migration has been applied to the database, you will need to manually reverse the changes it made.

data.name: NoParameterlessConstructor
data.value: No parameterless constructor was found on '{contextType}'. Either add a parameterless constructor to '{contextType}' or add an implementation of 'IDbContextFactory<{contextType}>' in the same assembly as '{contextType}'.

data.name: LogNotExistDatabase
data.value: Database '{name}' did not exist, no action was taken.

data.name: InvokeStartupMethodFailed
data.value: An error occurred while calling method '{method}' on startup class '{startupClass}'. Consider using IDbContextFactory to override the initialization of the DbContext at design-time. Error: {error}

data.name: CouldNotSerialize
data.value: Could not serialize {obj} [{name}]
